data.title: Bowling Round Score
data.solution:
highest = {0,"N/A"}
for i=1,io.read() do
    t=0; doP2 = true

    next_token = string.gmatch(io.read(), "[^%s]+")
    A = next_token()
    P1 = next_token()
    P2 = next_token()

    if tonumber(P1) then
        t=t+P1
    elseif P1=="X" then
        t=10; doP2 = false
    end
    
    if doP2 then
        if tonumber(P2) then
            t=t+P2
        elseif P2=="/" then
            t=10
        end
    end
    if t >= highest[1] then
        highest[1] = t
        highest[2] = A
    end
end
print(highest[2])
data.statement:
You must determine who achieved the highest score in the round.

The scores that you may be given are as follows:
[[X]] Strike
[[/]] Spare
[[1-9]] The scores 1-9
[[-]] Miss
data.constraints:
Length of [[A]] < 256
Length of [[P1]] = 1
Length of [[P2]] = 1
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read A:word(256) P1:word(1) P2:word(1)
write WINNER
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>> [[N]] players in the game
[[N]] <<lines...>>
[[A]] The player's name
[[P1]] The score the player achieved on the first part of the round
[[P2]] The score the player achieved on the second part of the round
data.outputDescription: The name of the player who won the game. There will always only be <<one>> winner.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must determine who achieved the highest score in the round.

The scores that you may be given are as follows:
X Strike
/ Spare
1-9 The scores 1-9
- Miss
Input
Line 1 N players in the game
N lines...
A The player's name
P1 The score the player achieved on the first part of the round
P2 The score the player achieved on the second part of the round
Output
The name of the player who won the game. There will always only be one winner.
Constraints
Length of A < 256
Length of P1 = 1
Length of P2 = 1
Example
Input
2
Josh 3 /
Jack - -
Output
Josh
